headline: JD Vance blames his age for saying “stupid” things dissing Trump
author: David Hudson
sentences:
“I’ve been very public about the fact that I voted for the president in 2020, that I was wrong about the president back in 2015 [and] 2016, and that he’s been the greatest president of my lifetime for the very simple reason, there are many, but one very important reason, that he revealed the corruption within Washington DC.”
Vance went on to say his age in 2016 had been a factor.

Earlier this year, he criticized President Biden for contemplating conflict with Russia over Ukraine, telling Steve Bannon, “We did not serve in the Marine Corps to go and fight Vladimir Putin because he didn’t believe in transgender rights.

Which is what the U.S. State Department is saying is a major problem with Russia.”

Since announcing his political ambitions, Vance has taken an increasingly far-right, America First standpoint on a range of issues.
This included last year suggesting that childless people, such as Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg (childless at the time), should have fewer votes than people with children.

He was a great President.”
After calling Trump and “idiot,” “noxious,” and “reprehensible” in 2016, JD Vance now says he is the greatest president in his lifetime.

This includes candidate JD Vance, the venture capitalist who also became a bestselling author with the publication of his memoir, Hillbilly Elegy.

As his nod of approval will likely result in a boost at the polls, most of them are saying whatever they can to court his favor.
He also mocked Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez for highlighting the existence of two-spirit individuals.
Asked about his change of heart last night, Vance said Trump’s performance in the White House had impressed him.
“One thing I’d point out is that I was just north of 30 years old when I said a lot of those things.
In 2016, he said he would not be voting for Donald Trump and posted a string of anti-Trump tweets.
